conbody.p: This guide provides instructions for a single-cluster deployment of Eucalyptus Open Source release 2.0.3 on a two-machine system running CentOS 5.6. Only one network mode is supported for these scripts: MANAGED_NOVLAN.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: Eucalyptus consists of the following distributed components:

ul.li: CC: Cluster Controller (middle-tier cluster management service)

section.title: Hardware Requirements
section.p: You will need a minimum of two machines to host Eucalyptus components.
Be sure that all machines are running the latest release of CentOS 6.2. Test that all systems allow SSH login, and that root access is available (sudo is okay).

ul.li: You must have a DHCP server available (installed but not running).
You must have range of available public IP addresses. These will be assigned to VM instances.
You must have large range of available private IP addresses. These will be used by a virtual subnet. They cannot overlap or contain any part of a physical network IP address space.

section.title: Software Requirements
section.p: You must have access to the following:

ul.li: CentOS 5.6 install CD #1. You can find the image on one of the mirrors here: http://isoredirect.centos.org/centos/5/isos/x86_64/. The file is labeled CentOS-5.6-x86_64-bin-1of8.iso.
